Module ActiveRecord::ConnectionAdapters::ConstraintHandlers::Postgresql::ClassMethods

Constants

NOT_NULL_REGEXP = Regexp.new("PGError: +ERROR: +null value in column \"([^\"]*)\" violates not-null constraint")
UNIQUE_REGEXP = Regexp.new("PGError: +ERROR: +duplicate key violates unique constraint \"([^\"]+)\"")
FOREIGN_REGEXP = Regexp.new("PGError: +ERROR: +insert or update on table \"([^\"]+)\" violates " + "foreign key constraint \"([^\"]+)\"")

Public Class methods

included(base)

When the include of ActiveRecord::ConnectionAdapters::ConstraintConnectionHook happens this hook is called with ActiveRecord::Base as the base. We extend the base with the class methods so they are class methods and the instance variables are then class instance variables.

handle_create_or_update_exception(e)

Called with exception when create_or_update throws an exception

[Source]

     # File lib/activerecord_constraint_handlers.rb, line 202
202:         def handle_create_or_update_exception(e)
203:           raise e until e.is_a? ActiveRecord::StatementInvalid
204:           logger.debug("trace_report create_or_update error is '#{e.message}'")
205:           if md = NOT_NULL_REGEXP.match(e.message)
206:             errors.add(md[1].to_sym, "can't be blank")
207:           elsif md = UNIQUE_REGEXP.match(e.message)
208:             constraint = md[1]
209:             ffoo(constraint, "has already been taken")
210:           elsif md = FOREIGN_REGEXP.match(e.message)
211:             table = md[1]
212:             constraint = md[2]
213:             ffoo(constraint, "is invalid")
214:           else
215:             logger.debug("Nothing matched")
216:           end
217:           false
218:         end
